DOC.brief_summary: The primary objective study evaluate safety tolerability aerosolize surfactant , specifically lucinactant inhalation , administer escalate inhaled dos preterm neonates 29 34 week gestational age receive nasal continuous positive airway pressure ( nCPAP ) respiratory distress syndrome ( RDS ) , compare neonate receive nCPAP alone .
DOC.brief_title: Trial Assess Safety Tolerability Lucinactant Inhalation Premature Neonates
DOC.criteria: Informed consent legally authorize representative Gestational age 29 34 complete week ( 34 week 6 day ) post menstrual age ( PMA ) Successful implementation control nCPAP within 90 minute birth Spontaneous breathe Chest radiograph consistent RDS Need moderate level supplemental oxygen nCPAP maintain oxygen saturation 88 % 95 % least 30 minute within first 21 hour birth Heart rate stabilize 100 beats/minute within 5 minute birth Recurrent episode apnea occur initial newborn resuscitation period ( ie , 10 minute birth ) require intermittent positive pressure breath use inflate pressure set CPAP pressure administer manually mechanically patient interface A 5 minute Apgar score < 5 Major congenital malformation ( ) cranial/facial abnormality preclude nCPAP , diagnose antenatally immediately birth Other disease condition potentially interfere cardiopulmonary function ( eg , hydrops fetalis congenital infection TORCH ) Known suspect chromosomal abnormality syndrome Prolong rupture membrane ( PROM ) > 2 week Evidence hemodynamic instability require vasopressor steroid hemodynamic support and/or presume clinical sepsis Need endotracheal intubation mechanical ventilation Has administer : another investigational agent exposure investigational medical device , surfactant agent , steroid treatment birth
